subject: Re: [junit] Unable to post to MockObjects.org users mailing list
msgSnippet: Hi Stephen, I am one of the admin on the Mock Objects project. I can assure you the list is alive (although we are of course looking for more participation and
messageBody:
Hi Stephen,

I am one of the admin on the Mock Objects project. I can assure you the list
is alive (although we are of course looking for more participation and
feedback). There are 2 lists, one for users and one for development. To
subscribe, simply go the mailing-list page
(http://sourceforge.net/mail/?group_id=18189) and click on "subscribe", then
enter your email address and pick a password. You'll receive a confirmation
email to which you'll need to answer. That's all !

Thanks for your interest and we're looking forward to seeing you on the list
soon. You're right about the unclear usage, we are working on writing
documentation and are looking for feedback to prioritize actions.

Cheers,
-Vincent

P.S.: Send me an email privately if you still have a problem subscribing.

----- Original Message -----
From: <stephen.peterson@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, August 23, 2001 6:36 PM
Subject: [junit] Unable to post to MockObjects.org users mailing list


> Hi all,
>
> I am having trouble communicating my experiences with the software
> located at www.MockObjects.com. I've used it a bit in IBM VAJ, and
> really like it so far, but it would be great if I could interact with
> other users of this software, since alot of aspects of usage are
> still pretty unclear. But I cannot seem to find link or button in
> the SourceForge page for posting to the list from the list archive
> page, even though the preceeding page clearly says 'Choose a list to
> browse, search, and post messages'.
>
> I realize I may very well be missing something very simple that when
> explained to me will make me feel quite dumb. On the other hand, I
> don't see very many postings in that public user list, so perhaps
> something there is broken?
>
> Is anyone else having similar frustrations, or is it just me? The
> EasyMock alternative, I think, requires jdk 1.3, which IBM VAJ does
> not yet support, so I was hoping to bank on the MockObjects framework
> to provide much needed help in building my unit-tests.
>
>
>
> To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
> junit-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com
>
>
> Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
>
>
>
